;;路易斯·迪亚兹在巴兰基亚与父亲团聚。
;

;利物浦球员路易斯·迪亚兹已团聚与他的父亲一起，他于 10 月底在哥伦比亚北部被游击队的一个部队绑架，并于上周获释。

;

;哥伦比亚足协在 X（前身为 Twitter）帐户上发布的照片​​捕捉到了这名前锋，他的父亲路易斯·曼努埃尔·迪亚斯·希门尼斯互相拥抱。联合会以“欢迎卢胡回家”的消息宣布老迪亚兹抵达巴兰基亚，哥伦比亚国家队将于周四在那里对阵巴西队。

;

;骑摩托车的武装人员绑架了迪亚兹的父母。 10 月 28 日，巴兰卡斯小镇的一个加油站。他的母亲 Cilenis Marulanda 在数小时内被警察救出，警方在这座拥有 40,000 人的小镇周围设置了路障，该小镇位于哥伦比亚与委内瑞拉边境附近。

;

;绑架事件发生后，特种部队被派去搜寻迪亚兹的下落父亲在横跨哥伦比亚和委内瑞拉的山脉中。警方还悬赏提供线索的信息。

; ;

;最初并不清楚是谁实施了绑架。哥伦比亚政府随后宣布，其掌握的信息表明民族解放军（ELN）的一支部队对此负责。该组织后来承认了绑架事件，称这是一个错误，其最高领导层;下令释放父亲;。

;

;迪亚兹的父母在哥伦比亚政府与哥伦比亚政府之间的和平谈判期间被带走游击队。当局在周末逮捕了四名嫌疑人。

;

;哥伦比亚监察员办公室估计，2022 年 1 月至 2023 年 9 月期间，武装团体实施了 160 起绑架事件，并释放了 121 人。

;

;迪亚兹的父亲被释放后，政府的和平谈判代表团在一份声明中要求民族解放军立即释放其仍“囚禁”的任何人，并结束其绑架行为。“从道德角度来看，认为与人类进行贸易是合法的，这是不可持续的。” ，即使是在武装冲突的情况下，”声明中写道。

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 02:52:01 +0800 ‘You’re finally free’: Matt LeBlanc pays tribute to Matthew Perryhttps://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2023/nov/14/youre-finally-free-matt-leblanc-pays-tribute-to-matthew-perry
;;2023-11-14T18:22:55Z;
;
;;勒布朗在他的 Instagram 页面上发布了一条令人心酸的消息，在马修·佩里去世两周多后向他告别。< /div>;

;马特·勒布朗向他已故的《老友记》联合主演马修·佩里致敬，称他的一些“最喜欢的时光”是和这位演员一起度过的。

;

;周二，两周多了佩里去世后，勒布朗在他的 Instagram 页面上发布了一条令人心酸的信息，向他的朋友告别。 56 岁的勒布朗在精选的美国情景喜剧中扮演乔伊·崔比亚尼和钱德勒·宾的照片中写道：“马修。我怀着沉重的心情告别。

;

;“老实说，我们在一起的时光是我一生中最喜欢的时光。很荣幸能与你同台，并称你为我的朋友。

;

;“当我想起你时，我会一直微笑，我永远不会忘记你。绝不。展开你的翅膀，飞吧，兄弟，你终于自由了。

;

;“非常的爱。我猜你还保留着欠我的 20 美元。”

;

;《老友记》演员勒布朗、大卫·休默、柯特妮·考克斯、丽莎·库卓和詹妮弗·安妮斯顿齐聚一堂 ;据美国报道，佩里于 11 月 3 日在森林草坪公墓举行葬礼;

;

;在向美国刊物《人物》发表的一份联合声明中，佩里的联合主演们表示，他们“彻底崩溃了”，并形容他们的关系“不仅仅是演员伙伴”。 “我们是一家人，”他们说。

;

;其他较小的演员在佩里去世后表达了哀悼。扮演钱德勒时断时续的女友贾妮丝·霍森斯坦的玛吉·惠勒在 Instagram 声明中表示，她感到“很幸运”能够与佩里一起度过充满创意的时刻。大卫（库卓在该剧的几集中扮演的菲比的爱人）在他的社交媒体上发布的视频中表示，他的“天才”朋友佩里帮助他清醒了。

;

; 2022 年，佩里出版了他的回忆录《朋友、恋人和可怕的大事》，其中他坦诚地谈论了如何应对毒瘾和酗酒的问题。马修·佩里基金会在这位明星去世后成立，以纪念他，承诺继续致力于“帮助其他与毒瘾作斗争的人”。

;

;下午 4 点刚过，洛杉矶警方回应了无线电呼叫据巴勒斯坦通讯社了解，10 月 28 日，对一名 50 多岁男性的死亡进行调查。洛杉矶消防局埃里克·斯科特上尉向巴勒斯坦权力机构发表声明称，他们在“独立的按摩浴缸中发现了一名昏迷不醒的男性”。

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 02:52:01 +0800 One third of New Zealanders doubtful incoming coalition can work well together, poll findshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/15/new-zealand-election-results-coalition-poll-work-together
;;2023-11-14T18:00:43Z;
;
;;法案领袖 David Seymour（左）、即将上任的总理兼国家党领袖 Christopher Luxon 和新西兰优先党领袖 Winston Peters< /div>;

;投票给 ;新西兰的新领导层尚未转化为人们对即将上任的三党政府将进行建设性合作的广泛信心，而越来越多的人不确定该国是否走在正确的轨道上，新的《卫报》要点新西兰民意调查发现。

;

;在 ;最终选举结果;显示，中右翼国家党将要求自由主义法案和民粹主义的新西兰第一党组建政府.

;

;选举一个月后，随着即将上任的总理和国家党领导人之间的联合谈判，该国仍对政府将采取何种形式一无所知 ;Christopher Luxon;，法案领导人;大卫·西摩;和新西兰优先党领袖;温斯顿·彼得斯;继续拖下去。

;
;

;;相关：;;由于政府联盟谈判拖延，选举后一个月新西兰陷入困境;

;
;

;在最新的《卫报基本新西兰》民意调查中，37 % 的受访者表示，他们对三方能否开展建设性合作没有信心，而 31% 的受访者相信可以，32% 的受访者表示没有强烈的感觉。

; ;

;该民意调查还记录了不确定该国是否正在走向世界的人数有所增加方向正确——23%，高于 10 月份的 14%。近一半（48%）的人认为该国走在了错误的道路上，低于上个月的 57%； 29% 的人认为它走在正确的轨道上，与 10 月份的民意调查相比没有变化。

;

;虽然国家党和行动党是传统的联盟伙伴，但由资深议员 Peters 领导的新西兰优先党;可能会令人沮丧其他政党对其一些核心政策的雄心，包括国家党允许外国买家重返房地产市场的计划，以及国家党和法案希望大幅削减公共服务。

;

;民意调查受访者对于国家党是否会在其削减公共服务员工以减少政府支出的计划中取得正确的平衡，人们存在分歧——43%的人认为它不会达到正确的平衡，42%的人认为可以，另外15%的人不确定。

;

;与之前的民意调查结果类似，生活成本、经济、健康、确保公平税收和解决犯罪问题是受访者认为政党解决“非常重要”的前五个问题。

;

; >;

;当就国家党领导的政府可能对这些问题产生什么样的影响进行调查时，大多数人认为这将使经济、犯罪、税收和生活成本压力变得更好，但受访者认为国家党改善健康、解决住房危机和保护高危儿童的可能性较小。

;

;与此同时，只有 16% 的受访者认为即将上任的政府将缩小贫富差距，而 35% 的人认为这会加深分歧。在气候变化方面，17% 的人认为这会改善该问题的行动，23% 的人认为这会让事情变得更糟。

; ;

;越来越多的受访者认为，总体而言，工党领导的政府和国家党领导的政府都不会带来真正的改变生活成本危机的支持率——11 月份高达 53%，而 8 月份的结果为 43%。

;

;工党经历了自该国实行混合成员比例以来现任政府最严重的失败1996 年，该制度的席位从 2020 年选举时的 65 个席位增至 2023 年的 34 个。尽管如此，受访者对于其在任期间取得的成就的看法几乎是均等的——47% 的人认为其取得了很多成就或还算不错。数量，而 50% 不同意。

;

;但受访者对政党领导人的看法凸显了更换领导层的愿望。在投票进入议会的政党中，;克里斯·希普金斯;是唯一一位受欢迎程度下降的领导人：39% 的人对他有积极的评价，而 10 月份这一比例为 44%。与此同时，Luxon 的支持率略有上升，从选举前的 33% 上升至选举后的 37%。

;

;;;•; 这项民意调查由新西兰的签署机构 Essential Research 进行。政治民意调查代码 – 样本量为 1,193，使用按年龄、性别和地点代表目标人口的配额。没有资格或不打算投票的受访者被排除在投票问题之外。使用新西兰统计局的年龄、性别和地点因素以及新西兰选举委员会数据的 2023 年政党投票数据对数据进行加权。该民意调查是在 2023 年 11 月 ;; 9;; 至 12;; 期间通过在线小组进行的，最大误差范围为 +/- 2.8%，称重效率达90%。 ;

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 02:22:02 +0800 Édith Piaf’s voice re-created using AI so she can narrate own biopichttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/nov/14/edith-piaf-voice-recreated-using-ai-so-she-can-narrate-own-biopic
;;2023-11-14T17:32:45Z;
;
;;艾迪丝·琵雅芙于 1955 年表演。
;

;在她去世六十年后，艾迪丝·琵雅芙的声音将是使用 AI 重新创建来讲述她的传记片。

;

;如 ;据 Variety 报道;，华纳音乐集团 (WMG) 已与 Piaf 庄园合作制作长片《伊迪丝》。人工智能经过训练，可以通过向其提供数百个语音片段来复制 Piaf 的声音，WMG 承诺由此产生的重新创作将“进一步增强她故事的真实性和情感影响”。

;

;动画将被使用为这位《La Vie en Rose》歌手的故事提供“现代视角”，“同时纳入档案片段、舞台和电视表演、个人片段和电视采访，将为观众提供真实的皮雅夫一生中的重要时刻”。这位法国歌手的原创表演也将被使用，但没有宣布人工智能技术将用于开发新音乐。

;

;这部电影正处于概念验证阶段，WMG 与制作公司合作非常高兴能进一步发展它。

;

;朱莉·韦耶 (Julie Veille) 是关于戴安娜·罗斯 (Diana Ross)、斯汀 (Sting) 和史蒂夫·旺德 (Stevie Wonder) 的法国纪录片导演，她构思了这个作品。 “在创作这部电影时，我们不断问自己，‘如果伊迪丝还和我们在一起，她想向年轻一代传达什么信息？’”她在一份声明中说。 “她的故事充满了令人难以置信的韧性，克服了困难，挑战了社会规范，取得了伟大的成就，无论在现在还是在当时，她的故事都具有现实意义。我们的目标是利用动画和技术的最新进步，将永恒的故事带给所有年龄段的观众。”

;

;皮亚芙遗产的执行人凯瑟琳·格拉瓦斯 (Catherine Glavas) 和克里斯蒂·劳姆 (Christie Laume) 表示：“这是一个特别的项目能够再次听到伊迪丝的声音是一次令人感动的经历——这项技术让我们感觉就像回到了与她在一起的房间。动画很漂亮，通过这部电影我们将能够展示伊迪丝真实的一面——她快乐的个性、她的幽默和她坚定不移的精神。”

;

;这并不是第一次死去的艺术家意外地发生这样的事情。作为旁白回归：2022 年，安迪·沃霍尔的声音通过人工智能为 Netflix 纪录片《安迪·沃霍尔日记》重新制作。演员比尔·欧文 (Bill Irwin) 朗读了他的日记，然后使用 AI 软件程序 Resemble 将其转变成沃霍尔的声音，从而形成了沃霍尔 1982 年制作的机器人版本的 21 世纪想象。

;

;演员爱德华·赫尔曼 (Edward Herrmann)与《安妮》和《吉尔莫女孩》等电影和电视角色一起成为著名的有声读物旁白，在他于 2014 年去世后，人工智能已被用来重新创建他的声音，并允许他为新出版的有声读物进行旁白。他的儿子称赞总部位于伦敦的 DeepZen 公司的技术是“继承他遗产的绝佳方式”。

; ;

;这种做法在 2021 年纪录片《走鹃：一部关于安东尼·波登的电影》中使用时被证明是有争议的a>;，关于已故厨师兼纪录片导演安东尼·波登 (Anthony Bourdain)，他于 2018 年去世。导演摩根·内维尔 (Morgan Neville) 使用根据波登声音训练的软件重新创建了波登发给朋友的一封电子邮件，其中一封仿冒的波登反映道：“我的生活有点糟糕现在。你成功了，我也成功了，我在想：你幸福吗？”

;

;摩根表示观众;不一定会意识到其中的花招;，他说：“如果你看这部电影……你可能不知道另一部电影是什么台词是人工智能说的，你不会知道。”批评者包括波登的前妻奥塔维亚，她写道：“我当然不是那个说托尼会对此很冷静的人。”

;

;在音乐领域，约翰·列侬的声音最近通过人工智能软件被隔离< a href="https://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/oct/26/the-beatles-final-song-now-and-then-ai-technology">;帮助幸存的披头士乐队时不时地录制唱片;，他们在一起的最后一首歌。保罗·麦卡特尼强调，该软件并不是用来创造新的列侬表演：“没有任何东西是人工或综合创造的，”他说。 “这一切都是真实的，我们都在玩它。我们清理了一些现有的录音。”

;

;但是人工智能越来越多地被歌手用来制作完全原创的表演，他们的声音被用来训练人工智能软件，然后创建准确的复制品 - 而艺术家自己经常反对

;

;四月份，在说唱歌手 Ice Spice 使用他的人工智能版本进行虚假音乐表演后，Drake 表示“这是最后一根稻草”。当月环球音乐集团还抱怨“使用生成式人工智能创建的侵权内容”，并且 ;从流媒体服务中提取了一首歌曲;，其中包含令人信服的 AI 创建版本的 Drake 和 Weeknd。

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 01:52:02 +0800 Pro-Palestine protesters disrupt Canadian book prizehttps://www.theguardian.com/books/2023/nov/14/pro-palestine-protesters-disrupt-canadian-book-prize
;;2023-11-14T14:50:04Z;
;
;;在多伦多丰业银行吉勒奖颁奖典礼期间，一名抗议者举着“丰业银行资助种族灭绝”标语，被护送下舞台.
;

;支持巴勒斯坦的抗议者两次扰乱周一晚上举行的加拿大著名文学奖颁奖典礼。

;

;10万加元的丰业银行吉勒奖颁奖典礼第一次因抗议者跳上舞台而被打乱标语上写着“丰业银行资助种族灭绝”。活动主持人 Rick Mercer 试图从抗议者手中撕下其中一个标牌。

;

;;视频片段;显示另一位抗议者站在观众区，高喊丰业银行“目前在埃尔比特系统公司持有 5 亿美元的股份”，并且“埃尔比特系统公司正在支持以色列军队对巴勒斯坦人民的种族灭绝”。

;

;埃尔比特系统公司是以色列的一家公司总部位于武器制造商，拥有 ;长期以来因向以色列军队提供物资而受到活动人士;的批评。 4 月份，美国调查新闻媒体 ;The Intercept 报道;丰业银行持有股份该公司的股东估计为 5 亿美元，成为最大的外国股东。

;

;“我们不会再保持沉默，”一名抗议者补充道。据《环球邮报》报道，吉勒发言人罗宾·莫吉尔 (Robyn Mogil) 表示，这群人很快被警察护送出去，随后被捕。

;

;在宣布获奖者名单时，活动也被中断。加拿大作家莎拉·伯恩斯坦凭借小说《服从研究》获奖，该小说也入围今年的布克奖。当她的名字被叫到时，一名冒充摄影师的抗议者开始大喊大叫，因此组织者重复了这一消息。

;

;该活动是在以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡 (Benjamin Netanyahu) 在 10 月 7 日哈马斯袭击后宣战后一个多月举行的。导致 1,200 名以色列人死亡。此后，已有超过 11,200 名巴勒斯坦人被杀害，在过去 10 天里，有 20 万人被杀害 ;已逃离;加沙北部。

;
;

;;相关：;;“在过去的四个星期里，语言抛弃了我”：Adania Shibli 谈被关闭;

;出生于蒙特利尔的伯恩斯坦在苏格兰高地的家中远程领奖，她最近在那里生了孩子。在她的视频获奖感言中，她没有承认抗议活动。

;

; Tue, 14 Nov 2023 22:22:01 +0800 Hong Kong lecture by British barrister linked to Jimmy Lai trial cancelledhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/14/hong-kong-lecture-by-british-barrister-linked-to-jimmy-lai-trial-cancelled
;;2023-11-14T13:26:23Z;
;
;;Timothy Owen
;

;A lecture in Hong Kong by the British barrister embroiled in a legal battle over whether he can represent the pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai has been cancelled without explanation, raising concerns about the diminishing space for free speech in the semi-autonomous Chinese city.

;

;Timothy Owen KC was due to give a talk entitled “Judges, Democracy and the Criminal Law” at the University of Hong Kong (HKU) on 17 November. But on Tuesday, the lecture was cancelled without explanation,; ;with the university citing “unforeseen circumstances”. The website for the law faculty appears to be offline.

;

;The talk was co-hosted with Boase Cohen & Collins, a local law firm. Last month, in ;an article advertising the talk;, Colin Cohen, a senior partner, said he was “thrilled” that Owen had accepted the firm's invitation to deliver the lecture, adding: “We are certain that his talk will be hugely popular with a large cross-section of the legal profession and the general public.” The link to register for the talk is no longer active.

;

;The talk had been advertised as a discussion of “the growing threats to judicial independence and the rule of law with particular focus on the administration of criminal justice”.

;

;HKU declined to elaborate on the reason for the cancellation. Boase Cohen & Collins have been approached for comment. Owen declined to comment.

;

;Owen has clashed with the authorities over his ability to represent Lai in his national security trial.

;

;Lai, 75, is charged with colluding with foreign forces under the city's national security law, charges the ;British government describes as “highly politicised”;.

;

;In November 2022, Hong Kong's top court ruled that Owen could defend Lai in the trial, despite multiple objections from the territory's Department of Justice.

;

;Hong Kong's chief executive, John Lee, then asked Beijing to intervene, prompting an ;“interpretation” of Hong Kong's national security law; to clarify that foreign lawyers could not work on national security cases without approval from the city's chief executive, or head of government.

;

;This interpretation was later enshrined into Hong Kong's law, with the authorities ;using that new power to block Owen from Lai's case; in May. Lai's legal team is appealing against that decision.

;

;The cancellation of Owen's talk at HKU comes after a number of incidents that have raised concerns about academic freedom in the Chinese territory.

;

;In October, it emerged that Rowena He, a Canadian historian who researches the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre, had been fired from her post as an associate professor at the Chinese University of Hong Kong, after the city's immigration authorities declined to extend her visa.

;

;Last year, Ryan Thoreson, a US human rights scholar who had previously worked at Human Rights Watch, was denied a visa to teach human rights law at HKU. No explanation was given.

; Tue, 14 Nov 2023 21:52:02 +0800 ‘Woman with the flower tattoo’ killed in Antwerp in 1992 is identified as Britonhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/14/rita-roberts-identified-british-woman-flower-tattoo-killed-antwerp-1992

;
;;An Interpol composite showing Rita Roberts and the tattoo that helped to identify her body.
;

;A woman's body found 31 years ago in Antwerp has been identified as that of a British national, Rita Roberts, after police appealed to the public for help in identifying 22 women murdered in Belgium, the Netherlands and Germany over the past 50 years.

;

;Operation Identify Me was ;launched in May; by the Belgian, Dutch and German police, which, with Interpol, the international policing organisation, released details of the cases that would normally only be available to law enforcement agencies.

;

;The case of ;“the woman with the flower tattoo”;, as Roberts was described, dated back to 3 June 1992 when a woman's body was found against a grate in the Groot Schijn River in the Deurne district of Antwerp.

;

;Described as aged between 20 and 50, light skinned and dark haired, she was wearing a dark blue, purple and light green T-shirt with the inscription “Splinter” and “1990”, along with blue Adidas training trousers and dark brown walking shoes, size 40.

;

;Her most striking physical feature, however, was a tattoo on her left forearm showing a black flower with green leaves and with “R'Nick” written underneath.

;

;Interpol said on Tuesday that it was this that had allowed Roberts' body to be identified, after a member of her family recognised the tattoo and contacted the organisation and Belgian authorities via the ;Identify Me website;.

;

;It said Roberts was 31 when she moved to Antwerp from Cardiff in February 1992, and she last communicated with her family via a postcard in May that year. Her family have since travelled to Belgium and formally identified her, Interpol said, allowing the Antwerp family court to amend her death certificate to reflect her identity.

;

;Roberts's family said in a statement that the news had been “shocking and heartbreaking. Our passionate, loving and free-spirited sister was cruelly taken away. There are no words to truly express the grief we felt at that time, and still feel today.”

;

;The family said it had been “difficult to process, but we are incredibly grateful to have uncovered what happened to Rita …; ;This cross-border collaboration has given a missing girl back her identity, and enabled the family to know she is at rest.”

;

;They described their relative as “a beautiful person who adored travelling. She loved her family, especially her nephews and nieces, and always wanted to have a family of her own. She had the ability to light up a room, and wherever she went, she was the life and soul of the party. We hope that wherever she is now, she is at peace.”

;

;Interpol's secretary general, Jürgen Stock, said such cases “underline the vital need to connect police worldwide, especially when missing persons are involved”. After 31 years, “an unidentified murdered woman has been given her name back and some closure has been brought to her family”, Stock said, describing Operation Identify Me as “important work”.

;

;Belgian authorities have issued an appeal to the public for any information they may have on Roberts or the circumstances surrounding her death, which they said could be submitted via a form on Interpol's website.

;

;The Identify Me website includes facial reconstructions of some of the murdered women, as well as videos and pictures of recognisable items such as jewellery and clothing discovered at the sites where their bodies were left.

;

;It marks the first time information from so-called Interpol black notices – used by police forces to seek intelligence on unidentified bodies and determine the circumstances of the death – has been made public. The notices contain details of the scene, the victim's appearance and clothing and other relevant observations, and are usually restricted to police.

; Tue, 14 Nov 2023 20:52:02 +0800 YouTube to offer option to flag AI-generated songs that mimic artists’ voiceshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/nov/14/youtube-to-offer-option-to-flag-ai-generated-songs-that-mimic-artists-voices
;;2023-11-14T12:26:33Z;
;
;;The Weeknd and Drake performing at the O2 Arena in London.
;

;Record companies can request the removal of songs that use artificial intelligence-generated versions of artists' voices under new guidelines issued by YouTube.

;

;The video platform is introducing a tool that will allow music labels and distributors to flag content that mimics an artist's “unique singing or rapping voice”.

;

;Fake AI-generated music has been one of the side-effects of leaps forward this year in generative AI – the term for technology that can produce highly convincing text, images and voice from human prompts.

;

;One of the most high-profile examples is Heart on My Sleeve, ;a song featuring AI-made vocals purporting to be Drake and the Weeknd;. It was pulled from streaming services after Universal Music Group, the record company for both artists, criticised the song for “infringing content created with generative AI”. However, the song can still be accessed by listeners on YouTube.

;

;The Google-owned platform said in a blogpost it would trial the new controls with a selected group of labels and distributors before a wider rollout. YouTube said the select group were also participating in unspecified “early AI music experiments” that involve using generative AI tools to produce content.

;

;YouTube will also allow people to complain about deepfakes in an update to its ;privacy complaint process;.

;

;“We'll make it possible to request the removal of AI-generated or other synthetic or manipulated content that simulates an identifiable individual, including their face or voice,” said the platform, adding that parodic content or deepfakes of public officials and well-known individuals might not be removed.

;

;“Not all content will be removed from YouTube, and we'll consider a variety of factors when evaluating these requests,” YouTube said in the blogpost by Jennifer Flannery O'Connor and Emily Moxley, product management VPs at the company.

;

;YouTube will also require creators to disclose when they have made realistic looking “manipulated or synthetic” content, including AI-generated material. When content is uploaded, creators will be presented with an option to flag synthetic footage. YouTube said persistent flouting of the guidelines could result in content being removed or advertising payments being suspended.

;

;YouTube said the new AI guidelines were especially important “in cases where the content discusses sensitive topics, such as elections, ongoing conflicts and public health crises, or public officials.”

;

;A label flagging AI-generated content will be added to a video's description panel but content about sensitive topics will receive a more prominent label. AI-made material will be removed altogether if it violates existing content guidelines, YouTube said, such as a synthetically created violent video designed to cause shock or disgust.

;

;Last week Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, said it would require political advertisers to acknowledge when they have used AI in ads on its platforms. Meta said advertisers will, for example, have to disclose when image, video or audio content is used to depict a real person doing something they did not say or do.

;

;Last month the UK government warned that deepfakes could contribute to a “degradation of the information environment” and reduce public trust in “true information, institutions and civic processes such as elections”.

;

;Last week it emerged that fake audio clips of Sadiq Khan, the London mayor, dismissing the importance of Armistice Day were ;circulating on social media;.
